Posts.Content: Jun 26, 2008 03:43AM JanDun1 wrote: I had a core needle biopsy 6/10 and that evening went and saw Rush in concert. I kept it iced up until we went and had a fabulous time. You should be fine.

Posts.Content: Nov 12, 2008 06:56AM JanDun1 wrote: I will be having surgery December 10th. My doctor says they do mastectomies in outpatient now, I opted to stay at the hospital overnight. I was also told expect 4 to 6 week recovery.

Posts.Content: JanDun1 wrote: Hi, I received 4 dd A/C and 4 dd Taxol prior to having bi-lateral mastectomy with node dissection. Path report shows I have 1 positive node after having Chemo. Anyone had this result? What did they do for you next?  Dx 6/10/2008, ILC, 6cm+, Stage IIIA, Grade 1, 3/25 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Node Pos after Chemo JanDun1 econmom
Node Pos after Chemo JanDun1 econmom

Posts.Content: JanDun1 wrote: Finished my AC & T neoadjuvant treatments last week. My case was discussed before the tumor board at the hospital I'm being treated at this past Monday. Spoke with the surgeon who told me my mammogram looks the same as it did prior to treatment. Granted, my mammo prior to treatment showed very little, it was the mri that showed a large questionable area. Has anyone else had this situation? What was the outcome? After going through 4 months of treatment, this is not the news I was hoping to hear.  Dx 6/10/2008, ILC, 6cm+, Stage IIIA, Grade 1, 3/25 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: mammo looks the same post chemo JanDun1 JanDun1

Posts.Content: Nov 13, 2008 05:56AM JanDun1 wrote: Hi, They said the surgery will tell all and that we need to wait for the path reports. My surgery is scheduled for Dec 10th. I have just been waiting so long and still know so little.

Posts.Content: Nov 13, 2008 06:27PM JanDun1 wrote: Thanks for the encouraging replys. I'm sure the chemo must have done more than just take my hair. I'm not angry just anxious to be through with all of this. I will be having a bi-lateral mastectomy. I had DCIS previously in one breast, now I have ILC in my other. I have a strong family history of bc also so mastectomy is my only option. Thanks again. I hope you both have a speedy recovery back to good health.
